renderer

Class Render

extends java.lang.Object

      • renderImage

        public void renderImage()
        Rendering an image by iterating through every pixel in our view plane, defined by width and height from the imageWriter object, constructing a Ray throw it and looking for intersections with any Geometry from the scene object. For pixels with no intersections, the background color of the scene is painted, and for pixels with intersections are painted by calculating the color at the closest point to the viewer(the camera object from the scene).

      • renderImageAntiAliasing

        public void renderImageAntiAliasing(int antialiasing)
        This method render an image as the renderImage does, with the difference in the number of rays that are created through every pixel. Additional rays are created and given a certain weight, and the final color is calculated according to the colors and weight of the color from every ray. Rendering images anti aliased can be more real like, with edges less jagged, but also takes more time to render than the renderImage method.
        Parameters:
        antialiasing - Number of additional rays to construct over a pixel.
        See Also:
        renderImage

      • printGrid

        public void printGrid(int interval)
        Generates a grid image, painting WHITE every interval pixels.
        Parameters:
        interval - Distance between lines of the grid.

      • addColors

        public static java.awt.Color addColors(java.awt.Color c1,
                                       java.awt.Color c2)
        Parameters:
        c1 - First Color to add
        c2 - Second Color to add
        Returns:
        The resulted Color between the sum of the given Colors. This method makes sure that won't be over or underflow, regardless the input.

      • addColors

        public static java.awt.Color addColors(java.awt.Color[] colors)
        Parameters:
        colors - Array of Colors to sum.
        Returns:
        The resulted Color from the sum of all Colors in the array.

      • scaleColors

        public static java.awt.Color scaleColors(java.awt.Color color,
                                         double value)
        Parameters:
        color - Color to be scaled by a value
        value - Value to scale a Color
        Returns:
        The resulted scaled Color from the multiplication of the parameters. This method makes sure that won't be over or underflow, regardless the input.
